required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Post-market Study Evaluating Clinical and Radiographic Early Outcomes pf Hip Arthroplasty With SL Cementless Stem.

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to evaluate the clinical, radiographical and patient-reported outcomes measurements up 3 years FU and to assess the survivorship of SL Cementless Stem after partial or total hip arthroplasty.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The trial is open-label, not randomized, retrospective and longitudinal cohort clinical study. The follow up outcomes of each patient are compared with the baseline measurements of the same subject (preoperative assessment for clinician-based evaluations and patient-reported outcomes; immediate postoperative assessment for the radiographical evaluation)

primary_outcome.description: Radiographic implant evaluation and stability assessment of the SL Cementless Stem on collected radiographs as per clinical practice during hospitalization and routine visits.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks, 3 months, 1 year, 3 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the clinical evaluation of the SL Cemetless Stem used in real life settings over a period of 3 years through PROMs if available and medical evaluation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks, 3 months, 1 year, 3 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence, type and severity of all Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Device Effect (ADEs), Serious Adverse Device Effects (SADEs) at intraoperatively/discharge, 6 weeks, 3 months, 1 year, 3 years after the implant;

arm_group.description: Since the trial is not comparative, the only arm implies the use of the investigational device (SL cementless femoral stem)

intervention.description: Total or partial hip arthroplasty with implant of SL cementless femoral stem.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients that underwent to partial or total hip arthroplasty and implanted with SL cementless stem between Jan 2012 and Jan 2020 at Nemocnice Kyjov Hospital (CZ) in accordance with the indication for use of the product and site standard of practice.
- Patients' radiographs availability of at least 4 of the 6 visits (mandatory baseline radiographs).
- Patient is willing and able to complete additional follow-up evaluations if needed after signing ICF;
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 years;
- Female patients who are pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy
